347.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG Enterprises, took to Twitter to recall that he met Russian President Vladimir Putin several years ago. "I found him shrewd, calm, charismatic and nationalistic. They say that the face becomes the mirror of the mind," he wrote. His tweet included an artwork showing Putin with fangs, surrounded by houseflies.

348.title: 6 barge into rented accommodation, thrash 3 women for wearing shorts in Pune
348.article_body: Six persons have been booked for allegedly barging into a rented accommodation in Pune and thrashing three women with footwear for wearing shorts. The accused also allegedly abused the complainant, who is the owner of the house, and threatened to demolish her house. The complainant alleged the accused were angry because the women wore shorts and roamed in the locality.

349.title: Stop support of SAP products till Russian tanks attack Ukraine: Vice PM to SAP
349.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has asked Germany-based software firm SAP to stop support of its products in Russia instead of just stopping its sales. "We ask you to stop support of SAP products, as long as Russian tanks and missiles attack Ukraine!" he said. "Bloody invader's army continues to kill our civil population," Fedorov added.

350.title: NHRC issues notices as 4 die while cleaning septic tank in Pune
350.article_body: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday issued notices to the Maharashtra Chief Secretary and Pune City Police Commissioner after four people allegedly died while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in the city. "It is completely unwarranted that the poor people die for their livelihood due to lackadaisical attitude on the part of the authorities," NHRC said.

351.title: 4 booked, official suspended over destruction of rocks in Hyd's Khajaguda Hills
351.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly destroying rock formations in Hyderabad's Khajaguda and also encroaching the area. Six security guards have been placed in the area to prevent further encroachment and the responsible Village Revenue Assistant has been suspended. This comes in response to an ongoing campaign by activists and heritage enthusiasts against encroachment of Khajaguda Hills.

352.title: Virat Kohli becomes 6th Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket
352.article_body: Virat Kohli has become sixth Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket. The 33-year-old reached the 8,000-run mark after scoring his 38th run in first innings of first Test against Sri Lanka, which marks his 100th Test. Other Indians to score at least 8,000 Test runs are Sunil Gavaskar, Sachin Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, VVS Laxman and Virender Sehwag.

353.title: Barca Prez Laporta told me 1000 times Xavi won't be the manager: Koeman
353.article_body: Former Barcelona head coach Ronald Koeman said the club's President Joan Laporta told him a "1000 times" that Xavi would not be the team's manager as he "lacked" experience. "I still find it painful. I was not Laporta's coach. I had that feeling from the first moment after the elections there was no connection between us," added Koeman.

354.title: Greenfield airport to be set up in Arunachal Pradesh’s Hollongi
354.article_body: The Airport Authority of India has undertaken the construction of a Greenfield Airport in Hollongi, 15 Kms from Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar. With eight check-in counters, the terminal will be able to accommodate 200 passengers during peak hours, a press release by the Ministry of Civil Aviation stated. The energy-efficient building will also be provisioned with a Rain Water Harvesting system.

355.title: I'm seeking your trust again: Macron announces re-election bid
355.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday announced that he's standing for re-election. "I'm seeking your trust again. I'm a candidate to invent with you, faced with the century's challenges, a French and European singular response,'' he said in a letter to French people. If Macron succeeds, he'll be the first French President in 20 years to win a second term.

356.title: Chelsea's owner Abramovich helped pick Putin’s 1st cabinet: Piers Morgan
356.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "Memo to Chelsea fans...justifying their defence of Abramovich...: he literally helped pick Vladimir Putin's first cabinet." "That's why he won't criticise Putin," added Morgan in his tweet. "Abramovich is one of Putin's closest advisers," Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier said.

357.title: I had no chance: Eoin Morgan on going unsold in IPL mega auction
357.article_body: Having scored 133 runs in 17 matches for KKR in IPL 2021, Eoin Morgan admitted he had "no chance" after the first round in the IPL mega auction, despite leading KKR to the edition's final. "It's a fact that I have not scored enough runs," said Morgan. "I am never grateful for hard lessons," added the English cricketer.

358.title: I can only think about Chelsea with Russian owner Abramovich: Tuchel
358.article_body: Reacting to Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich's decision to sell Chelsea having bought the club in 2003, manager Thomas Tuchel said he can only think about Chelsea with Abramovich, adding that it's "very hard" for him. "It hasn't sunk in yet that this is going to stop," stated Tuchel. "Every decision he takes is the right decision," he said.

359.title: Virat Kohli has developed India's bowling strength: Gautam Gambhir
359.article_body: Talking about former Team India captain Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir said Kohli has "developed" India's bowling strength, adding that bowlers win you matches and batters "only" set the match up. "If you talk about Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, you have experienced players like Hanuma Vihari and Shreyas Iyer who can replace them," stated Gambhir.

360.title: Cyberpunk 2077 video game maker halts all sales to Russia & Belarus
360.article_body: Poland-based developer of video game Cyberpunk 2077, CD PROJEKT RED, is halting all sales of its products to Russia and Belarus. "The entire CD PROJEKT Group stands firm with the people of Ukraine," it said. "We do believe that commercial entities, when united, have the power to inspire global change in the hearts and minds of ordinary people," it added.

361.title: I wouldn't be the person I am if it wasn't for Rodney Marsh: Watson
361.article_body: Reacting to ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh's demise, Shane Watson tweeted, "I wouldn't be the person I am...if it wasn't for Rod...[He had an] amazing skill to know how to get the best out of every young cricketer." "I am absolutely shattered," added Watson in his tweet. "Australia has lost a cricketing icon and legend," read a tweet from Aaron Finch.

362.title: Petition submitted to Karnataka CM to reduce Bengaluru bus fare
362.article_body: Advocacy group Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has submitted a petition to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and Transport Minister B Sriramulu for reducing bus fares and providing free service to women, transgenders and senior citizens. The petition sought ₹1,000 crore/year for Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) for this. BMTC fares are highest among all Indian cities, it claimed.

363.title: Nearly 1,000 primary schools for girls shut down in 5 years in Guj
363.article_body: As per the Socio-Economic Review report 2021-'22, around 1,000 primary schools for girls were shut down in the past five years in Gujarat. The number dropped to 1,330 in 2020-'21 from 1,429 in 2016-'17. Moreover, the enrolment of girls in primary schools slipped from 41.98 lakh to 39.80 lakh during this period.

364.title: Europe's largest nuclear power plant seized by Russian military, claims Ukraine
364.article_body: The Russian military has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant Zaporizhzhya NPP in Ukraine, State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate of Ukraine said in a statement. "Operational personnel are monitoring the condition of power units," it added. Russian forces had attacked the plant on Friday morning, setting an adjacent five-storey training facility on fire.

365.title: Elon Musk warns Starlink could be 'targeted' in Ukraine, shares ways to keep caution
365.article_body: Days after SpaceX activated Starlink satellite broadband service in Ukraine, CEO Elon Musk warned there's a high probability of it being targeted amid Russia's invasion. "Starlink's the only non-Russian communications system still working in...parts of Ukraine...Please use with caution," he wrote. "Turn on Starlink only when needed and place antenna...as far away from people as possible," he said.

366.title: Ex-Pune Police Commissioner gets relief from arrest in phone tapping case till Mar 25
366.article_body: Bombay High Court on Friday granted relief from arrest to former Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla till March 25. She has filed a plea before the court seeking cancellation of the FIR against her. Police had registered an FIR against Shukla in connection with the alleged phone tapping of Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole during the previous BJP-led Maharashtra government.

367.title: Every 8th individual in India suffers from glaucoma: PGIMER doctors
367.article_body: Every eighth individual of almost 138 crore people in India suffers from or is at risk of developing glaucoma, doctors from Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) said on Thursday. "Glaucoma is characterised by damage to the optic nerve leading to irreversible blindness," Dr Surinder S Pandav from PGIMER said. It commonly affects people aged above 40.

368.title: Amitabh has presented my emotions perfectly: Vijay Barse on 'Jhund'
368.article_body: Vijay Barse, the man who started Slum Soccer in India, has said his "favourite actor" Amitabh Bachchan has presented his emotions perfectly in the film 'Jhund'. "It was...great experience to see Amitabh as myself on screen...I realised many times that the way he expressed Vijay Barse was exactly what I felt at that particular moment of my life," he added.

369.title: Debris falling from mountains crushes 3 U'khand women; body of 1 woman found
369.article_body: Three women were crushed by debris that fell from mountains in the Luthiyag village of Uttarakhand. The body of one of the women has been taken out, Rudraprayag District Magistrate said. Search for the two other women is underway. The victims had gone to collect gravel and concrete when the accident took place, as per reports.

370.title: US may impose sanctions on India: US diplomat as India abstains from UN vote on Russia
370.article_body: Top US diplomat Donald Lu has said that the US administration was still considering sanctions against India over the purchase of a missile defence system from Russia. His comments came after India abstained from a vote on the UN General Assembly (UNGA) resolution to condemn the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Further, Lu described India as an important security partner.

371.title: What's the big deal: Neelam on receiving botox treatment on 'Fabulous Lives...'
371.article_body: Neelam Kothari, when asked if she was comfortable getting filmed while receiving botox treatment on show 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives', said, "I...feel...people make such a big deal of botox and...all these procedures...and I just feel 'what's the big deal?'" "You're gonna age one day and you're gonna do stuff to make yourself feel good and look good," Neelam added.

372.title: Maid held in Hyd for robbing elderly woman after blinding her with Harpic
372.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Wednesday arrested a caretaker for allegedly blinding a 73-year-old woman with Harpic and Zandu Balm and robbing her. Accused P Bhargavi was appointed as caretaker by the victim's son and had been living with her since August 2021. After applying the poisonous solution, Bhargavi robbed the victim of ₹40,000, two gold bangles and other valuables, police said.

373.title: Aviation veteran Sanjiv Kapoor appointed Jet Airways CEO
373.article_body: The Kalrock Capital and Murari Lal Jalan consortium, Jet Airways' new promoters, has appointed Sanjiv Kapoor as CEO of the airline. Kapoor, who was previously SpiceJet's Chief Operating Officer and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer, resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels on Thursday. "By having Sanjiv as CEO...I'm certain Jet Airways will reclaim its lost glory," Jalan said.

374.title: Airbnb is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus: CEO
374.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has revealed that the firm is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine. This comes days after Chesky had said US sanctions on Russian banks had affected its ability to operate within the country.  Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to one lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine.

375.title: 60-yr-old K'taka man enters mosque, threatens to kill religious leader; held
375.article_body: Police have arrested a 60-year-old man for allegedly trespassing into a mosque in Karnataka's Mangaluru and threatening to kill the religious leader there. A knife was seized from the two-wheeler vehicle he came in, police said. So far, it remains unclear why he threatened to kill the religious leader and more details will be available after further questioning, police added.

376.title: Russia blocks access to BBC's website, Facebook, Google Play: Report
376.article_body: The BBC's website appeared to be blocked in Russia as reports said there were problems accessing the website, hours after it brought back shortwave radio technology to cover the Russia-Ukraine war. BBC Russia's Twitter account claimed that Facebook parent Meta, Google Play Store and German public broadcaster Deutsche Welle also appeared to be blocked in Russia.

377.title: Nuclear reactors being shut down at Ukraine power plant after Russia attack: US
377.article_body: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm has said the reactors at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant are being safely shut down, adding that they are protected by robust containment structures. Granholm tweeted that she spoke with Ukraine's energy minister about the situation at the plant, where a fire broke out during fighting between Russian and Ukrainian forces.

378.title: Man held for killing partner in Gurugram 4 yrs after he killed her husband
378.article_body: Police arrested a 42-year-old woman's live-in partner for allegedly strangling her to death, two days after she was found dead at her house in Gurugram. The accused also confessed to murdering her husband in 2018, police said. The woman and accused had been in a relationship since 2014 and in 2018, her husband became aware of their affair, police added.

379.title: Putin's actions threaten Europe's safety: UK PM after nuclear plant fire
379.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of endangering all of Europe after Russian troops attacked Europe's biggest nuclear power plant in Ukraine and sparked a fire. Johnson said that he would seek an emergency UN Security Council meeting in the coming hours over Putin's "reckless actions". The fire at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station has been extinguished.

380.title: Who have played the most Test matches for India?
380.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli today became the 12th Indian to feature in at least 100 Test matches. Sachin Tendulkar has played the most Test matches for India (200). He is followed by Rahul Dravid (163) and VVS Laxman (134). The current BCCI President Sourav Ganguly represented India in 113 Test matches.

381.title: Ex-Australia keeper Rodney Marsh dies aged 74, seven days after suffering heart attack
381.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh passed away aged 74, seven days after suffering a heart attack in Queensland. He had effected 355 dismissals in Test cricket, a world record at the time of his retirement. He was also the first Australian wicketkeeper to score a Test century. He is survived by wife Roslyn and sons Daniel, Paul and Jamie.

382.title: Ali Fazal exits 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues: Reports
382.article_body: Ali Fazal, who was set to star in 'Fukrey 3', has reportedly exited the project due to scheduling issues. The actor is currently shooting for Vishal Bhardwaj's 'Khufiya' and will be "busy with the thriller till March-end", a source told Mid-Day. 'Fukrey 3', starring Pulkit Samrat, Varun Sharma, Manjot Singh and Richa Chadha, went on floors on Wednesday.

383.title: Class 3 girl allegedly raped by teacher, school manager in UP
383.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her teacher and the school manager in Muzaffarnagar on Thursday. On returning home, the class 3 student narrated the incident to her father who then immediately lodged a police complaint. Circle Officer Kuldeep Singh said that the two accused have been arrested under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

384.title: Every household should develop its own solar tree in coming years: PM
384.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that every household in India should develop its own solar tree that can contribute to saving up to 15% of electricity. "It'll not only be unique but will be environment-friendly," he added. "In the coming years, India's energy demands will increase, therefore, we must transition to renewable energy," PM stated.

385.title: Pune man strangles wife to death on suspicion of affair; arrested
385.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested in Pune on Thursday for allegedly beating and strangling his 35-year-old wife to death. The incident reportedly occurred a day before during a fight over the man's suspicion that the deceased was having an extramarital affair, according to the police. The deceased's body was sent for post mortem at Sassoon General Hospital.

386.title: Mumbai's Digha Railway Station likely to be operational by November this year
386.article_body: Around 70% of the work of Mumbai's Digha Railway Station has been completed and authorities expect to make it operational by November this year, said Ravi Agarwal, Chairman and MD, Mumbai Rail Vikas Corporation (MRVC). The station is being built under Phase-1 of the Mumbai Urban Transport Project (MUTP) 3. It will reportedly help decongest the Thane station.

387.title: 5 arrested as B'luru police bust extortion racket; ₹1.6 lakh seized
387.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested four home guards and a man posing as a journalist for allegedly running an extortion racket. The police have also recovered about ₹1.6 lakh. The home guards reportedly would enter a spa and accuse its owner of running a prostitution racket, following which the false journalist would threaten to publish the news, a police officer said.

388.title: 92% COVID-19 deaths during third wave among unvaccinated: Govt
388.article_body: During the third COVID-19 wave, 92% of the deaths were reported among those who were unvaccinated, Director-General of Indian Council of Medical Research Dr Balram Bhargava said. "This is data from three databases with more than 94 crore population," he added. "The Indian graph is very much lower than the other countries, many of them developed countries," Bhargava further said.

389.title: Russian embassy road in Lithuania to be named 'Ukrainian Heroes Street'
389.article_body: The Lithuanian capital will name the road leading up to the Russian embassy "Ukrainian Heroes Street", Vilnius Mayor said. "Everyone who writes to the embassy will have to give a thought to the victims of the Russian aggression and about the heroes of Ukraine," Remigijus Simasius added. The city council will adopt the change on Wednesday, the mayor said.

390.title: 60-yr-old woman tries to set herself on fire outside Mantralaya in Mumbai
390.article_body: A 60-year-old woman poured kerosene on herself and tried setting herself ablaze outside the Mantralaya in Mumbai. The woman alleged that she had been framed by police in a case and demanded action against the concerned police officer. She further asked to cancel the FIR filed against her in the case.

391.title: Some contract staff stuck in Ukraine: US EV infrastructure firm CEO
391.article_body: US EV infrastructure firm ChargePoint CEO Pasquale Romano has said that around 20 of the firm's contract employees are stuck in Ukraine amid the ongoing war. He said the employees are not able to flee after the Ukrainian government banned men of ages 18 to 60 years old from leaving. He added ChargePoint is searching for ways to help them.

392.title: Singer Aditya Narayan, Shweta Agarwal blessed with a baby girl
392.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan and his actress-wife Shweta Agarwal have been blessed with a baby girl. Aditya has revealed that their daughter was born on February 24. "I have already started singing songs to her. Music is in her DNA," he added. "Shweta and I feel extremely blessed that we are parents now," he added.

393.title: Analyst toasts to 'death' of Russian stock market on TV, says 'Rest in peace, comrade'
393.article_body: With Russian stock market being closed for four straight days after the country's invasion of Ukraine, stock exchange analyst Alexander Butmanov made a "funeral" toast to the stock market live on a business TV channel. "Dear stock market, you were close to us and interesting. Rest in peace, dear comrade," he said as he opened a bottle of soda water.

394.title: Security camera video shows fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine
394.article_body: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, took to Twitter to share a security camera video of fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Zaporizhzhia NPP is under fire! The entire Europe is at risk of a repeat of the nuclear catastrophe. Russians must stop fire!" he wrote.

395.title: TN proposes to send MPs, officials to countries adjoining Ukraine
395.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has proposed to send four lawmakers and four IAS officers to Romania, Poland, Hungary and Slovakia, countries that adjoin Ukraine, for evacuating over 1,000 Tamil students. State CM MK Stalin has sent the list of the team to Union Minister S Jaishankar for approval. "So far, about 193 students from Tamil Nadu have been facilitated," Stalin said.

396.title: Fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine extinguished
396.article_body: The fire caused by Russian shelling at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine has been extinguished, emergency services said. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he has informed the leaders of the US, Britain, the European Union and the International Atomic Energy Agency about the threat of nuclear disaster after Russian troops shelled the nuclear power plant.

397.title: 8.5 kg heroin worth ₹60 crore seized from 2 Kenyan nationals at Guj airport
397.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has arrested two Kenyan nationals with 8.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹60 crore at the Ahmedabad Airport in Gujarat. According to officials, the accused had hidden the narcotics in cavities inside their bags. "These passengers came to visit India on the pretext of medical visits on the basis of fabricated letters," DRI's statement said.

398.title: UK freezes assets of Russian billionaire & ex-deputy PM, imposes travel ban on them
398.article_body: The UK government has announced new immediate sanctions on two Russian oligarchs, which include a full asset freeze and travel bans. The two oligarchs are Arsenal FC's former billionaire shareholder Alisher Usmanov and Russia's former deputy PM Igor Shuvalov. "Putin associates [are] now cut off from their significant UK interests including mansions worth tens of millions," the government said.

399.title: Twitter to reopen all offices from March 15, staff can pick work from home 'forever'
399.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Twitter will reopen all its offices around the world from March 15 after nearly two years. However, he added that employees can work wherever they feel the most "productive and creative" and that includes "working from home full-time forever". They can also choose to work some days in office and some days at home.

400.title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 16,200 amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
400.article_body: The Sensex tanked more than 1,050 points on Friday amid weak global cues due to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The Sensex was trading below 54,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell around 320 points to trade below 16,200. Banks and auto stocks, Maruti Suzuki and Axis Bank, were among worst-hit during intraday trade.

401.title: HC seeks info from UP on meat sale ban in Mathura-Vrindavan wards
401.article_body: Allahabad High Court has sought information from Uttar Pradesh government over the ban on sale of meat and other non-vegetarian items in 22 wards under the Mathura-Vrindavan municipal corporation while hearing a petition. Last year, a state government order had declared these wards as "holy pilgrimage" sites. The petition asked the court to direct authorities not to restrict their businesses.

402.title: Allow firefighters access to Ukraine nuclear site: Biden to Russia
402.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy after a fire broke out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russian shelling, the White House said in a statement. "Biden joined President Zelenskyy in urging Russia to cease its military activities in the area and allow firefighters, emergency responders to access the site," the statement read.

403.title: Dad didn't want me to join film industry, hid an offer for months: Neelam
403.article_body: Actress and jewellery designer Neelam Kothari has revealed that her parents were not initially comfortable with her decision to forge a career in acting. "We didn't have...filmy background," she said, adding, "So I got [an] offer, but I think for months...dad didn't tell me. Because in their head it was a big capital 'NO', our daughter is never joining films."
